availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Smathers (Sharpsburg, Bath County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Nicholas and Bath County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Margaret Smathers. Father of Jo Ann Smathers. Farmer in Nicholas County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Nicholas County in 1850. Farmer in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Bath County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District 1, p.493B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Sharpsburg, p. 75.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 14.
Virgoleen Stephens, Bath Co. Cemetery Records, (Sharpsburg, KY), 63.
